data.title: Molly McAllister, DVM, MPH on LinkedIn: Hearing why people chose veterinary medicine always inspires me. Last…
data.meta_description:
Hearing why people chose veterinary medicine always inspires me. 
 
Last week at WVC, I had the chance to celebrate another group of Diversify Veterinary… | 12 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
Myxomatous mitral valve disease (MMVD) is the most prevalent acquired heart condition in dogs. It has been extensively studied in small and medium-sized breeds, but research into MMVD in large breed dogs remains comparatively scarce, leaving critical gaps in understanding and management. To address this, a recent study aimed to elucidate the characteristics, survival times, and prognostic variables in large breed dogs afflicted with MMVD, shedding light on crucial insights for veterinary practitioners. #veterinarycare #veterinary #integrativeveterinarymedicine #veterinarymedicine #MMVD #myxomatousmitralvalvedisease #largebreeddogs #doghealth

🚀 Don't Miss Out! Register Now for Our Upcoming Webinar! 🚀 Join us for "Raising the Bar in Veterinary Testing: Delivering High-Quality Care for Our Animal Companions," sponsored by Thermo Fisher Scientific. 🗓️ Date: 17th July 🕒 Time: 17:30 BST 📚 What You'll Learn: - The importance of high-quality veterinary diagnostics in animal care. - Latest advancements and technologies in veterinary diagnostics. - Various diagnostic tests and their applications in veterinary medicine. - Skills in interpreting and analyzing diagnostic results for accurate diagnoses. - Strategies for implementing quality assurance measures to ensure reliable outcomes. Equip yourself with the tools and knowledge to deliver optimal care and improve the well-being of our animal companions. 📍 Register Now via the link in the comments. #VeterinaryWebinar #VetTesting #AnimalCare #TheWebinarVet #ThermoFisher #VetCPD #VetCE #VeterinaryDiagnostics #AnimalHealth Don't miss this opportunity to elevate your practice! 🐾

Natalia Ignatenko, EBVS® European Veterinary Specialist in Small Animal Oncology, is the first and, so far, the only Ukrainian 🇺🇦 veterinarian who underwent residency training to become a veterinary specialist. She believes that oncology is not about death but about the quality of life of her patients. We live in exciting times because we can help effectively more and more patients. 🐕🐈 🔗 Discover more about #EUvetspecialists and their value to society at www.ebvs.eu #veterinarycareer #veterinarymedicine #veterinaryprofessionals #ECVIM #veterinaryoncology

Are you one of those veterinarians that look for solutions that allows offering the best possible animal care? Here how Dr Oñate, Veterinarian at Animals Vet in Chile say; “The Exigo diagnostic solutions provides fast, precise and accurate diagnostics, allowing us to make decisions immediately, instead of sending the samples away and waiting 24h for a result, which might potentially risk a patient’s life. Access to accurate results on site gives us the possibility to perform surgical procedures at all hours, even at night, increasing our capabilities and earnings but also saving lives. The Exigo diagnostic solutions increases the profit for the clinic and provides a benefit for the patient.” Learn how Exigo diagnostic solutions suits many types of veterinary clinics by being designed for robustness and ease-of-use. Learn more about Exigo https://lnkd.in/dUnvGT68 #exigo #hematology #customerstories #boule #animalhealth

This month, Prof. Dr. Guillermo (Memo) Tellez-Isaias attended the event "Decimosexto Congreso Internacional AVEM 2024". This event was a fruitful exchange of ideas, during which Prof. Dr. Tellez-Isaias had the opportunity to address the fascinating themes related to veterinary science addressed in the Special Issue "Nutraceuticals to Mitigate the Secret Killers in Animals" ✨ We are grateful to Prof. Dr. Tellez-Isaias for his commitment in Veterinary Science and for his contributions to science on veterinary topics. Learn more about the Special Issue at the following link: 🔗 https://lnkd.in/dzp-Ns4g

As the veterinary profession evolves in response to emerging challenges, Clinician’s Brief recently surveyed approximately 1,000 general practitioners to better understand how veterinarians grapple with the ever-changing landscape of animal care. With 63% of respondents reporting having contemplated leaving clinical veterinary medicine, the results of this survey demanded the attention of leaders in the field. Below, leaders from Merck Animal Health, Mars Veterinary Health, and the National Academies of Practice (NAP) discuss these survey findings with Dr. Indu Mani, Chief Scientific Officer. Follow along as we dive deep into these eye-opening insights from across the industry. #VeterinaryMedicine #IndustryInsights #AnimalCare
